column5: Grabbed a bucket of minnows and met up with a buddy on the Welland r. Found a  spot where a small feeder empties into the river and hoped for crappie, perch or smallies.  The action was pretty heavy for most of the afternoon, but not with the target species. There were a few nice perch, a couple of dink bass, and hundreds upon hundreds of these:   There were probably 3 year classes schooled up on the one spot. A half hour of one size followed by a half hour of another size, etc.... Gillies from 6"= 9 1/2". Kept a few fish ranging from 8-10" for a feed or two. Despite the weather being a bit off, not a bad afternoon.

out of minnows now, want me to bring ya some tommorrow????, I got a bunch of nice ones in the garage, and have a trap set overnight I am getting in the morning before heading out, bring a bucket  I see you must have caught a fish on every minnow you scooped today
Man, you eat fish every night or what? lol  Looks tasty!
At least 3 days a week   Me, the kids, and the puppies.  Actually, we had a shore lunch as part of a fun shore derby. Needed fish for 10 people. OF course, we had a few donors.
You got that right. Goes great with the bacon and eggs for brekkie
How do those blue gills taste?? I know a pond where there are hundreds of them swimming around and never bothered keeping any.
Try them, you won't be disappointed!  White flakey sweet meat!
They taste better than they smell when yer a cleanin' them.
